action.action-desc: Mr. Malinowski (for himself, Ms. Porter, Mr. Sherman, Ms. Eshoo, Mr. Casten, Mr. Jones, and Mr. Lieu) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify the limitation on the deduction by individuals of certain State and local taxes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Supporting Americans with Lower Taxes Act or as the SALT Act .

section.header: Modification of limitation on the deduction by individuals of certain State and local, etc., taxes

subsection.text: Section 164(b)(6) is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.header: Limitation on deduction by certain high-income individuals

subparagraph.text: In the case of a taxpayer with adjusted gross income which equals or exceeds $400,000 for any taxable year—

clause.text: foreign real property taxes shall not be taken into account under subsection (a)(1) (or section 216(a)) for such taxable year, and

the aggregate amount of taxes taken into account under paragraphs (1), (2), and (3) of subsection (a) and paragraph (5) of this subsection (and any tax described in any such paragraph taken into account under section 216(a)(1)) for such taxable year shall not exceed $60,000.

subparagraph.header: Phasedown of limitation based on adjusted gross income
subparagraph.text: The $60,000 amount in subparagraph (A)(ii) shall be reduced (but not below zero) by the dollar amount which bears the same ratio to $60,000 as—

clause.text: the excess of the taxpayer’s adjusted gross income over $400,000, bears to

subparagraph.header: Application restricted to certain taxpayers and taxes

clause.text: Subparagraph (A) shall only apply to individuals, estates, and trusts.

Subparagraph (A) shall not apply to any foreign taxes described in subsection (a)(3) or to any taxes described in paragraph (1) and (2) of subsection (a) which are paid or accrued in carrying on a trade or business or an activity described in section 212.

subparagraph.header: Married individuals filing a separate return
subparagraph.text: In the case of a married individual filing a separate return, subparagraphs (A) and (B) shall be applied—

clause.text: by substituting $200,000 for $400,000 each place it appears,
by substituting $30,000 for $60,000 each place it appears, and

subparagraph.text: In the case of an estate or trust, adjusted gross income shall be determined as provided in section 67(e).

Unless the taxpayer has less than $1,000,000,000 ($500,000,000 in the case of a married individual filing a separate return) in assets as of the close of the taxable year (and attests to such fact under penalty of perjury at such time and in such manner as the Secretary may provide)—

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Medicare vision and hearing trust fund

subsection.text: Subchapter A of chapter 98 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Medicare Vision and Hearing Trust Fund

subsection.text: There is established in the Treasury of the United States a trust fund to be known as the Medicare Vision and Hearing Trust Fund, consisting of such amounts as may be appropriated or credited to such fund as provided in this section or section 9602(b).
There are hereby appropriated to the Medicare Vision and Hearing Trust Fund amounts equivalent to the amounts received in the Treasury by reason of the amendment made by section 2 of the SALT Act.

Amounts in the Medicare Vision and Hearing Trust Fund shall be available, as provided in appropriation Acts, only for the purpose of providing vision and hearing benefits pursuant to the Medicare program established under title XVIII of the Social Security Act.
The table of sections for subchapter A of chapter 98 of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 9512. Medicare Vision and Hearing Trust Fund.
